Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater with lower part of rim; interior glazed black with reserved band near bottom of sherd; exterior: trace of laurel wreath on rim with reserved band at junction with body; below, red-figure decoration consisting of female facing right (head with added yellow circlet with three leaves, yellow drop earring and fingers of raised hand remaining); some relief-contour.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0212) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 124, pl. LXVII, no. 12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
